title: Lecture 13 Thread
content: <document version="2.0"><file url="https://static.us.edusercontent.com/files/nZvjX9QR0fCSiCYGFPxLZdWQ" filename="Lecture 13.pdf"/><paragraph>Use this to ask questions about DiffPool and the general design principles we used to figure out how to do pooling in a mostly generic way for graphs. The PDF above has been slightly annotated to reflect discussions in office hours. </paragraph><paragraph>We also started on RNNs, but will be continuing that on Thursday's lecture. </paragraph></document>
document:
Use this to ask questions about DiffPool and the general design principles we used to figure out how to do pooling in a mostly generic way for graphs. The PDF above has been slightly annotated to reflect discussions in office hours. 

We also started on RNNs, but will be continuing that on Thursday's lecture.

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>Sharing my notes for Lectures 12 & 13</paragraph><paragraph>Note: I combined my own class notes with the lecture slides and used an LLM to help generate the final summary.</paragraph><paragraph>Hope this is helpful!</paragraph><file url="https://static.us.edusercontent.com/files/0JwOCz2plgYv8ShVGL66fCkV" filename="lec12-13_GNN_chatgpt.pdf"/></document>
comments.document:
Sharing my notes for Lectures 12 & 13

Note: I combined my own class notes with the lecture slides and used an LLM to help generate the final summary.

Hope this is helpful!
